result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Marie Ocasio

records.addlTxt:
3:15 PM Defendant Michelle Marie Ocasio in court.  Attorney Blake Gross in court for Michelle Marie Ocasio.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, def is waiving right to prelim hearing.  Def agrees waiving right to prelim hearing, understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court finds PC that a crime has been committed in Ashland County case is bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now, mirrors complaint.  Atty reached an agreement with charge amended to misdemeanor.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:06 AM Defendant Michelle Marie Ocasio in court.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Michelle Marie Ocasio.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, reviewed complaint with def, waives reading, retaining right to prelim hearing, but waiving time limits.  Def, waiving right to time limits.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  If def appears by zoom needs to be with identification or with stipulation.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
